action.action-desc: Ms. Sánchez (for herself, Ms. Shea-Porter, Mr. Cicilline, Ms. Kaptur, Mr. Blumenauer, Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico, Mr. O'Halleran, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Butterfield, Mr. Langevin, Mr. Ellison, Ms. Jayapal, Ms. Pingree, and Mr. Sarbanes) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to clarify the application of the restriction on the appointment of relatives to a position in the Federal Government, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Relatives in Government Getting Employment Dishonorably Act or the RIGGED Act.

subsection.text: Section 3110 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(A) by inserting , including the White House Office and the Executive Office of the President after Executive agency;
by redesignating paragraphs (2) and (3) as paragraphs (3) and (4), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

paragraph.text: civilian position means any existing or newly created position in an agency, including a position acting in a professional or official capacity as a consultant or advisor, regardless of whether such position is voluntary, gratuitous, or authorized by law to be compensated;
in subsection (b), by striking A public official may not and inserting Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a public official may not; and

subparagraph.text: by inserting shall be removed immediately and after in violation of this section; and
by striking as pay and inserting as salary or expenses.

subsection.text: Section 2302(a)(2)(C) of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting , including the White House Office, after Executive agency.
